channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s Overdue Tariff Rollback
item.description: It would behoove the administration to apply the logic of the latest relief more broadly.

item.title: Women Need Good Men
item.description: Love is the antidote to our poisonous culture of abortion.

item.title: What 60 Minutes Got Wrong About Harvard and the Biomedical Research Enterprise
item.description: A recent segment was a sad attempt to cloak the shortcomings of academic science in hype, sentimentality, and public relations theater.

item.title: House Speaker Mike Johnson insists President Trump has 'clean hands' in Epstein case
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson says the push to release the Epstein files is nothing more than a "political exercise" meant to make President Trump look b...

item.title: Border Patrol commander touts dozens of North Carolina arrests leaving residents 'overwhelmed'
item.description: A top Border Patrol commander touted dozens of arrests in North Carolina's largest city on Sunday as Charlotte residents reported encounters with fede...

item.title: Trump seeks primary challenges against Indiana state lawmakers who defy redistricting demands
item.description: President Trump is calling for primary challenges against Indiana GOP lawmakers who failed to redraw the state's congressional maps as he had demanded...

item.title: An Addiction to Euphemism Is Corrupting Journalism — and Our Language
item.description: There are special-interest groups that move from newsroom to newsroom, offering style ‘tips’ to enforce favorable coverage of their pet causes.

item.title: The Democrats’ Epstein Dud
item.description: President Trump’s relationship with Jeffrey Epstein was embarrassing, but the latest releases contain no smoking gun.

item.title: Many House Republicans will back a bill to release Epstein files, leaders of the effort say
item.description: Lawmakers seeking to force the release of files related to the sex trafficking investigation into Jeffrey Epstein are predicting a big win in the Hous...

item.title: Sen. Tim Kaine defends Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer from liberal backlash
item.description: Sen. Tim Kaine of Virginia pushed back Sunday against liberal critics of Senate Minority Leader Charles E. Schumer.

item.title: After Removing Statue Of American Hero, UVA Plans To Replace It With Massive Land Acknowledgement
item.description: UVA just recently, supposedly, ended its era of capitulation to the thugs in the 'Black Lives Matter' tyranny, and it seems the least the school could...

item.title: Indiana Attorney General Subpoenas Amazon, Sues Indianapolis Schools Over Migrant Trafficking
item.description: Attorney General Todd Rokita issued subpoenas for information about potential labor trafficking from Amazon, the city of Fort Wayne, and a nonprofit s...

item.title: With Jocelyn Benson Set To Referee Her Own Race For Governor, Michigan GOP Asks DOJ To Monitor Election
item.description: Michigan Sec. of State Jocelyn Benson, a Democrat, will oversee her own election results when she appears on the ballot.

item.title: Ken Burns’ The American Revolution Kicks Off the Quarter-Millennial Celebrations
item.description: The famed documentarian takes on the American founding, and the result is an inspiring reminder that we have much to be grateful for.

item.title: Yes, President Trump Can Pardon The 77 People Prosecuted For 2020 Election Integrity Efforts
item.description: Media wrongly insist that the pardon clause only applies to federal charges, yet every attempt to narrow the scope of pardons has failed.
